text:
Hi guys,

Is the UI playground deprecated?
<https://app.HubSpot.com/extensible-ui/>

I find it quite useful for mocking up UI extensions but it's quite outdated.

Also, what are best practices for staging environments?

I saw that <@U07QTBMHX51> had multiple public apps created, which is similar to what I had.
The reason why I needed multiple apps was to test things before pushing to production.

Does the projects framework have a branching feature?
I see feature flags but I don't fully understand how they work yet:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/app-management/feature-flags>

I would love to limit new UI extensions to only a few users in beta and then deploy a stable version globally.

2 of my team members who are superadmins hs project dev is working but every time they try to upload with hs project upload the CLI show this error
```[ERROR] A system error has occurred:```
Without any other information…

I'm having trouble with an app that was generated from a Project. I try using the Sample Install URL from the Auth section of the auto-generated app to connect the app. However, when I connect the app, I go to the HubSpot account's settings -> Connected Apps and I don't see the app there. Are apps generated by projects kept elsewhere?
Hi <@U05KNCMAE7N>, I requested the figma kit access a couple of days back. Can you please approve that? Thanks!
